AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bihar: 9 more deaths due to heatstroke i.description: PATNA: Nine more people died of sunstroke in Bihar in last 24 hours, following fresh causalities reported from two districts- Aurangabad and Nawada. As the heat wave gripped most parts of Bihar, the death toll due to heatstroke has rose to 92 on Wednesday from 83 on June 18, though some areas in western and northern Bihar including Patna experienced slight respite following fall in temperature due to thunderstorm and lighting with light rain. According to data provided by the officials of Bihar State Disaster Management Authority, 41 people have so far died in Aurangabad which had earlier recorded 34 on Tuesday while two more person died in Nawada, increasing death toll to 14. The officials claimed that 35 died in Gaya and two in Jamui. With temperatures in several districts of Bihar hovering consistently at around 40 to 43 degrees Celsius, hospitals were inundated with people suffering from heatstroke. Many heatstroke victims are still in hospital, and some alleged deaths due to sunstroke were still unreported. Schools in Bihar will remain closed until June 23. Section 144 CrPc (illegal assembly) has been imposed in Gaya, Aurangabad and Nawada as the death toll due to sunstroke has rapidly increasing. Under this section, all construction activities and assembly of people in outdoor has been banned from 11am to 4pm. Additional DM of Aurangabad, Sudhir Kumar told this newspaper that as per the latest figure 48 deaths have been reported in district till Wednesday. “We have collected all the data from government hospitals and primary health centres (PHCs). Currently, nine patients suffering from heatstroke are going under treatment at hospitals and PHCs,” he said. At Gaya, Aurangabad and Nawada, the district administration with the help of non-government organisations have set up water kiosk for residents. Under the ongoing polio camps in these districts, the anganbadi sevikas are handing out ORS an electrolyte powder to people. Meanwhile, one Virendra Kumar, a resident of village Jaitipur under Islampur police station area died on way to Biharsharif Sadar hospital on Wednesday after being referred by the local PHC. According to his relatives, the deceased returned from a marriage party on Tuesday night. Soon after he complained of high fever and uneasiness, he was taken to the local PHC where doctors diagnosed him to be hit by heat stroke. When his condition did not improve doctors referred him to Biharsharif Sadar hospital and he died on his way to hospital. While a 56-year-old man identified as Jitendra Kumar of village Amba under Rahui police station area also died of heat stroke on Wednesday. Police also recovered body of an unidentified woman from a field at Kadilpur village under Telhara police station area who was suspected to have died of heat stroke. With these deaths, the total number of people who allegedly died due to heat stroke in Nalanda in the last four days rose to 10. According to district magistrate of Nawada, Kaushal Kumar, the death toll in Nawada rose to 15. The latest victim has been identified as 40-year-old Munni Devi, wife of a betel shop keeper Arjun Prasad and native of village Motibigha under Nawada town police station. Arjun admitted his wife to Nawada Sadar Hospital, where doctors referred her to Pawapuri Medical College and Hospital in neighboring Nalanda district. However, she succumbed on the way. With inputs from SB SinhaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Acute Encephalitis Syndrome toll climbs.description: MUZAFFARPUR: Fresh deaths due to acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) have been reported in Bihar's Muzaffarpur district, taking the total number of casualties to 113. The deaths took place at the Shri Krishna Medical College and Hospital (SKMCH), where 20 fresh cases were brought since Tuesday night. The number of children admitted to the hospital with AES are 372 since June 1, the district administration said. The SKMCH has reported 93 casualties so far and only 118 children have been discharged after treatment. The rest are undergoing treatment or referred to hospitals in the Patna in a critical condition, it said. In the Kejriwal hospital, two fresh cases of the AES were reported since Tuesday night, taking the total number to 146 since June 1. The hospital has so far reported 19 casualties, though none of these took place in the past 24 hours. One death was also reported from the neighbouring East Champaran district on Tuesday. A release by the state health department said 11 medical officers posted in Darbhanga, Supaul and Madhubani had been instructed to leave for Muzaffarpur immediately to help the local health authorities in tackling the outbreak. Three paediatricians posted in other districts have also been pressed into service, while 12 nurses have been directed to report to the the civil surgeon of Muzaffarpur. Anguished by the deaths, a Muzaffarpur resident has filed a petition at a local court against Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, his deputy Sushil Modi, Union health minister Harsh Vardhan, minister of state Ashwini Choubey and state health minister Mangal Pandey. The resident, Mohd Nasim, accused them of negligence, which has resulted in the high number of casualties. The chief judicial magistrate court has posted the matter for hearing next Tuesday. Nitish Kumar had on Tuesday visited the SKMCH hospital, where he faced protests by angry people over the deaths. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CBSE to serve notices on 472 schools in.description: PATNA: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) is to issue show-cause notices to 472 affiliated schools in Patna region over the poor results of students in Class X and XII board exams as well as flouting the norms of affiliation bylaws. “The CBSE has categorized the schools in A, B, C and D grades according to their performance in Class X and XII board exams,” a CBSE official from Delhi said. Schools with overall pass percentage above 70% are in Grade A while those having scored between 60% and 70% are put in Grade B. Schools with 40 to 60% success rate are in Grade C and below 40% overall pass percentage are in Grade D. The board will send show-cause notices to schools under Grade C and D. Of the total 472 schools to receive show-cause notices, Bihar alone has 300 schools. Altogether 213 schools failed to score above 40% result. There are total 888 schools in state affiliated to CBSE. Patna region includes Bihar and Jharkhand. CBSE city coordinator and principal of Baldwin Academy, Rajiv Ranjan Sinha, told this newspaper that the results of Patna region were worst. “The board has taken the right decision for penalizing such schools with poor results. Most of these schools failed to fulfil the affiliation bylaws, including disproportionate student:teacher ratio and lack of infrastructure among other issues,” he said. As per the CBSE affiliation bylaws, schools are permitted to enrol 40 students per class. This rule was made to accommodate the student-teacher ratio of 40:1 for all classes. “However, many schools did not follow this,” Sinha added. Abha Chaudhary, senior teacher of Notre Dame Academy, said the degrading result was a serious concern for the board and parents will now be able to categorize schools on their performance. “Several schools are running as non-attending schools, where students need not attend classes. Parents thought that after Class X, kids do not need to go to school. Rather they encourage their kids to take coaching classes to prepare for engineering and medical,” she said. She added: “There is only 0.1% chance that the flying candidates (who went to non-attending schools) succeed in both board exams as well as in competitive exams.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bihar\u2019s credit-deposit ratio declin.description: PATNA: Bihar’s credit-deposit ratio has declined by 1.29% in financial year 2018-19 compared to 2017-18. It is for the second time in the last 11 years that Bihar has reported decline in its C-D ratio, which indicates how much of the banks’ core funds are being used for lending activities. The state had been reporting constant improvement in its C-D ratio since FY 2008-09, except for FY 2016-17 when it reported decline by 1.05%. As per the credit-deposit data released by different banks at the 68th trimonthly meeting of the State Level Bankers’ Committee (SLBC) held here on Wednesday, Bihar reported 44.09% C-D ratio on March 31 this year, compared to 45.38% in the previous year, resulting in a decline by 1.29%. Different banks in the state distributed Rs1,45,120 crore as loan against the total deposit of Rs3,45,234 crore in FY 2018-19. In the previous years, Rs1,34,997 crore were distributed as loan against the deposit of Rs3,12,829 crore. However, the state reported an increase of Rs10,123 crore in lending in FY 2018-19 compared to 2017-18 when different banks across the state distributed Rs1,34,997 crore as loan. Presiding over the SLBC meeting, deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi, who is also the finance minister, expressed concern over decline in the C-D ratio and asked the zonal and regional heads of different commercial, cooperative and private sector banks to take necessary steps to improve it in the current financial year. Modi said two districts — Saran and Bhojpur — reported less than 30% C-D ratio in the last financial year. Saran has reported 29.22% while Bhojpur 29.40%. State’s agriculture minister Prem Kumar, rural development minister Shravan Kumar, industries minister Shyam Rajak, cooperative minister Rana Randhir, development commissioner Subhash Sharma and finance secretary S Siddhartha were present at the meeting, which is usually held after a gap of three months. Being the first SLBC meet of 2019-20, it was scheduled to be addressed by CM Nitish Kumar, but he could not attend it because of his participation in another meeting convened by PM Narendra Modi on the ‘One Nation-One Election’ issue. Later, while briefing media persons, Modi said majority of bank branches in the state were not accepting coins from traders. He said the banks must accept the coins. “I will raise this issue at the state finance ministers’ meet in Delhi on June 21,” SuMo said. He also pointed out that as per the RBI guidelines, loans under the Kisan Credit Card (KCC) scheme would be provided to only those farmers whose crops are insured under the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana. “But, Bihar government has launched its own scheme, namely Bihar Rajya Fasal Sahayata Yojana, to provide financial assistance to farmers. There should be no compulsion for farmers to join any scheme for availing the loan under the KCC,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Purnea University: Online admission proc.description: PATNA: Purnea University began the online process for admission to different postgraduate (PG) courses from Tuesday. The last date for submitting applications for the 2019-20 academic session is June 30. “The registration fee for general category candidates is Rs 1,000 each and that for SC/ST and OBC candidates is Rs 700 each. We will inform the shortlisted candidates after going through their applications in the first week of July,” Purnea University vice-chancellor (VC) Rajesh Singh told this newspaper. The university has invited online applications for admission to PG courses like physics, chemistry, mathematics, botany, zoology, Maithili, Hindi, English, Sanskrit, Urdu, Bangla, philosophy, psychology, economics, sociology, geography, home science, history, political science, music, Persian and commerce. Applications have also been invited for PG courses being taught at Purnea Mahila College and D S College-Katihar. “Students can apply online for admission to 12 self-financing courses as well. They include master of physical education, MSc in food science and technology, MSc in molecular breeding, PG diploma in green house technology, MSc in fisheries science, MSc in bioinformatics, MSc in geographic information system and remote sensing, MSc in horticulture and landscape, PG diploma in astrology and palmistry, Masters in company secretaryship, MBA and Master of Laws,” the VC said, adding the registration fee for general category students was Rs 1,000 each and that for others was Rs 800 each. According to the VC, the self-financing courses at the PG level are career-oriented. He said, “On successful completion of these courses, a student can work with reputed multinational companies as well as governmental organizations.” Purnea University has signed memoranda of understanding with several foreign universities to run its self-financing courses smoothly. Their faculty members have also agreed to teach students here. Entrance test: Purnea University is busy preparing for its maiden combined entrance test to be conducted for admission to different three-year undergraduate (UG) courses in arts, science and commerce streams on June 30. More than 80,000 students have applied for admissions. “They will be shortlisted for admission in different constituent and affiliated colleges of the university on the basis of their performance in the written test,” the VC said. Students from foreign countries like Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh and neighbouring states of Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal and Assam are also seeking admission to various courses of the university this year. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Foreign language courses in vogue.description: PATNA: Learning new languages in order to boost career prospects seems to be in vogue among youngsters these days. A number of centres have come up in the city that offer foreign language courses to them at affordable rates. Different universities have also started teaching foreign languages to open doors for students to study or work abroad. Patna University (PU), for instance, has been offering six-month certificate courses in Chinese, German and French since 2017. PU foreign language course coordinator Indiber Mukherjee told this newspaper, “At present, there are only 30 students enrolled in the three certificate courses. We are also planning to teach Spanish, Japanese and Korean, but are waiting for students to show interest in learning the three languages.” One has to pay Rs 10,000 at the time of getting oneself enrolled into any of these courses being offered by PU. “They are open for all. Outsiders, however, should have secured at least 50% marks in their Class XII exams,” Mukherjee said. Apart from PU, National Institute of Technology-Patna (NIT-P) has been offering Korean language courses to students since 2014. According to Korean teacher Grace Lee, as many as 150 students from different colleges and universities of Patna are learning about his country’s culture and language at NIT-P. There are several private language learning institutes operating in the city as well. They primarily offer courses in French, German, Korean and Spanish and charge anywhere between Rs 15,000 to 30,000, depending on the duration and difficulty level of the language. Neeraj Singh, who is learning German at a private language centre in S K Puri area, said, “Being multilingual has a lot of benefits. However, it is not easy to learn a foreign language. Learning German will enhance my chances at the job market in foreign countries.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Teens hooked to \u2018war games\u2019, e.description: PATNA: The online shoot-’em-up war games keeping youngsters glued to computer screens till late at night are also giving sleepless nights to parents across the world, and the teens and tweens of Patna are no different. With the increasing popularity of multiplayer online games such as PUBG (Players Unknown Battleground) in the city, mental health professionals have sounded the alarm bells. Gaming addiction is as real and dangerous as drug addiction, they say. The impact of these violent games, with high-quality graphic imagery, on the mental health of youngsters, especially children and teenagers, has forced even the World Health Organization (WHO) to take note. The WHO last month designated ‘gaming disorder’ as illness and updated its International Classification of Diseases (ICD) to include it in the list of modern diseases. Neuro-psychiatrist Rakesh Kumar says he is seeing a steady rise in number of young people, between the ages of 15 and 19, coming to him. Some of them even have suicidal tendencies as they feel they are worthless because they lost a few matches of these online games. Kumar cited the case of Class X student, who went into depression because of continuously losing while playing PUBG. He was playing more than four hours every day for the past 6 months and whenever he lost he locked himself in his room and wouldn’t come out for hours. Thankfully, his parents spotted the changes in his behavior and brought him for counseling. Another case that came to him was that of an undergraduate student who had suicidal thoughts because no one was ready to play the game with him, which led him to believe he was worthless and the only thought that came to his mind was of dying. War games such as PUBG are facing severe criticism from mental health professionals in the city for being an unhealthy obsession among youngsters. The game has too much violence, they say. Satyajeet Singh, neuropsychiatrist at AIIMS, Patna says, “Almost every day, 4 to 5 parents come to my clinic purely with the complaint of excessive use of mobiles by their kids even as young as 5 for over involvement in social media and games. It is toxic for personal relationships. Many of the children are either in depression or have just disconnected themselves from the outer world.”  “Anything that works on the brain that produces pleasure is addictive. It causes release of a neuro chemical called dopamine, which is a centre of drug of abuse causes,” he explains. City parents appear to be at a loss about how to deal with gaming addiction of their kids, which is creating a challenge for them to focus on their career and health. Sujita Singh, mother of an 18-year-old PUBG addict says, “My son has been playing PUBG for the past 3 months and it has resulted in decline in his academics. The game should be banned as soon as possible for the welfare of teenagers.” Another parent, Reena Mishra, says, “My son’s addiction to PUBG day after day is increasing. I am scared that he might ruin his life because of the game. I hate it when I see him playing this game.” Mental health experts suggest that parents should keep an alert eye on their children and should not hesitate to seek professional help if needed. “Education, awareness and recognition are the first steps to checking this epidemic. Practicing yoga, exercises and meditation are now forgotten arts for adolescents, although India used to be the home of all of the above,” says Singh of AIIMS advising parents to seek help when needed. “Play this game as a time pass but do not make it into an addiction. Play it when you need refreshment. Since it is a game, and therefore, meant for relaxation, one should not overindulge oneself in playing it,” he cautions. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Child deaths in Bihar: Advanced life-sup.description: PATNA: In view of the rising incidents of deaths due to AES/JE in Muzaffarpur and adjoining areas in Bihar, Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan has issued instructions for deployment of eight advanced life-support (ALS) ambulances in the affected districts. Accordingly, eight additional ALS ambulances were pressed into service for transportation of critical patients under the National Health Mission (NHM), a statement issued by the health ministry said. The central teams comprising 10 pediatricians and five paramedics each had started working on the ground, in coordination with the state government, it added. The teams were sent to Bihar on Wednesday. Vardhan further informed that 16 senior district officials and medical personnel were sent to the vulnerable blocks for monitoring and early identification of cases and ensuring daily reporting. Their headquarters were also shifted to these blocks, he said, adding that the district collector was involved in the process now and was personally taking responsibility for the same. The collector had deputed senior deputy collectors (SDCs) or district-level officers to lead various block teams, Vardhan was quoted in the statement as saying. These teams would be assisted by a district-level medical officer and a medical officer in-charge (MOIC) to do the overall work at the block level, the statement said. It added that the authorities in Bihar were given instructions to switch to daily surveillance and monitoring for detecting early warning signs of the disease. "The state government has started a social audit, along with an active case-finding campaign through a house-to-house survey, and is moving the prospective patients to the nearest PHC for early intervention. Surprise checks are also being conducted at the PHCs by SDCs. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

ACs and refrigerators flying off the she.description: PATNA: The long spell of scorching heat has led to surge in demand for airconditioners (ACs) and refrigerators, retailers in the city say. As most people prefer to stay indoors during the day time and night temperature also remains comparatively higher (around 30 degrees C), more and more people in the city are opting for airconditioners and refrigerators to beat the heat. Retailers and electronic appliances firms have also come up with several promotional offers, such as low-interest consumer durable loans, free installation, extended warranty and cashback in order to make them easily affordable for consumers. “We are happy with our sales this year as compared to last year. Consumers are also satisfied with our offers as we are providing them best products in an affordable range,” said Anuj Kumar Singh, general manager of an electronics showroom near Income Tax roundabout. Retailers offer discounts of 8-25% to the consumers, depending upon the product and their brand. “Airconditioners are out of stock and we are continuously ordering fresh stock. We are selling 30 to 35 refrigerators and 80 to 85 ACs per day. Split ACs priced in the range of Rs30,000 to Rs65,000 are more in demand this year because of its several smart features,” said a sales executive at an electronics showroom on Boring Road. “It is almost unbearable to live in such high temperature without AC. Though we could manage with coolers till last year, we decided to buy an AC this time. The price of AC was also quite affordable and the retailer provided us some extra discount,” said Nita Singh, who bought a split AC earlier this week. Refrigerators are also high in demand this summer. Retailers dealing with electronics items claimed that refrigerators are priced in the range of Rs16,000 to Rs35,000. Acute encephalitis syndrome spreads to n.description: MUZAFFARPUR: The ‘brain fever’ toll in Bihar went up to 114 on Wednesday with seven more deaths even as acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) cases spread to newer areas with reports of children admitted with similar symptoms coming in from Samastipur, Banka and Vaishali districts. Even as more and more cases are being brought in to the Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital in Muzaffarpur, where bulk of the patients are undergoing treatment, the hospital continues to be hampered by lack of proper facilities despite high-profile visits by ministers, including the CM and the Union health minister. TimesViewLittle children dying or suffering permanent brain damage is always a human tragedy, but when official apathy and neglect contirbute to it, that is criminal dereliction of duty. Bihar has seen these deaths happen year after year even if the numbers have in one year gone down and in another shot up. Muzaffarpur has been the epicentre. Given those facts, it is just inexcusable that the government has failed so miserably in ensuring the public health set-up is equipped to cope. Grand schemes count for little if they are of no help to poor families losing their little ones. Of course, tackling this disease needs more than just good PHCs or hospitals. As long as malnutrition is rampant, the problem will remain. To root it out, therefore, adequate nutrition is the first step. But that does not preclude effective medical intervention to ensure that the loss of lives is kept to the minimum if not eliminated altogether.Scarcity of beds and doctors coupled with unhygienic condition prevailed at the hospital even as the Bihar State Health Society issued a list of 15 doctors, technicians and nurses, who have been deputed by the Union health ministry to assist at the hospital in Muzaffarpur. “All 637 beds, including 30 in PICUs, in the hospital are full. We have to put two kids on one bed to accommodate more children,” SKMCH superintendent Sunil Kumar Shahi said. He admitted that there is a shortage of senior resident doctors in every department. “Though there is a shortage, it is inhuman to throw out patients just because we cannot accommodate them. Many of them have come from far-flung villages of north Bihar. Around 40 to 50 new cases of AES … come every day. But our resources are very limited.” To ease the situation, a makeshift paediatrics intensive care unit with 20 new beds and four new ACs were set up on Wednesday amid frequent power cuts. Hospital authorities said 154 children are undergoing treatment for AES at the three PICUs with 10 beds each with fresh cases coming in from neighbouring districts. In Vaishali, civil surgeon I D Ranjan claimed that 15 suspected cases of AES have been reported from Hajipur as well. “Several kids have died in their villages, while others died in the referral hospital before being diagnosed. However, their relatives claimed that they showed similar symptoms of high fever and convulsion among others,” Ranjan told TOI. In Samastipur, at least three of the seven infants with AES symptoms admitted to the Sadar hospital, were referred to SKMCH, one of whom died on the way. However, civil surgeon Siyaram Mishra denied admitting any AES patients at the hospital. Meanwhile, the death of 2-year old child at a village in Katoria block of Banka district due to suspected AES raised alarm in the health department. However, To cope with the situation in Muzaffarpur, DM Alok Ranjan Ghosh has cancelled the leave of all government employees in the district. “The total number of affected and admitted children has gone up to 5,530 since June 1 this year alone. Though, 187 kids have been discharged from the hospital; 101 children are still undergoing treatment at two medical institutions of the district. The conditions of 24 children are critical and have been kept on ventilators,” Ghosh said. “A massive awareness campaign has been started in all blocks with the help of Jiveeka associates and aanganwadi sevikas and sahayeekaa. Executive magistrates have been deployed in every block to monitor the awareness programme apart from keeping a close vigil on the patients, inflicted with AES,” Ghosh added. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

UG courses: PU declares entrance test re.description: PATNA: Patna University (PU) on Thursday announced the results of entrance tests conducted for admission of students to different three-year degree courses in arts, science and commerce. The results, which were published after a meeting of the principals of colleges and university officials held under the chairmanship of vice-chancellor (VC) Rash Bihari Prasad Singh, are available on PU’s website. It was decided in the meeting that the reservation roster provided by the state education department for the purpose of admissions would be strictly followed in all colleges and university departments. The revised 100-point reservation roster incorporates the latest provision of 10% quota for general category (economically weak) students. However, no decision on enhancement of seats was taken. The VC told this newspaper, “In case of any confusion on reservation roster, principals or heads of departments may contact the official of the state education department specifically assigned for the job. When selection lists are finalized by the colleges, a team of the university, led by the registrar, will also visit different institutions and ensure that the reservation roster has been followed correctly.” Now, the colleges will start counselling of successful students separately and verify their certificates. The list of candidates finally selected by the institutions will be forwarded to PU’s admission section and they will be admitted to a course in a particular college online. The admission fee and other miscellaneous charges will also be deposited online. The process of admission to the conventional postgraduate (PG) courses in different faculties also began on Thursday. Now, the PG departments will declare the cut-off lists on the basis of marks obtained in the last qualifying examination and the reservation roster. The last date for admission to all the UG and PG courses, both under conventional and self-financing modes, is July 9. An induction meet of the newly admitted students will be held between July 10 and 15 and classes of the next academic session will begin on July 16. Chancellor for redressal of teachers\u20.description: PATNA: Governor-cum-chancellor Lalji Tandon has asked Raj Bhavan officials to make arrangements for receipt of online applications from teachers and non-teaching staff of different universities so that their cases are disposed of at the earliest. Hearing the grievances of university people at the Raj Bhavan here, the chancellor said, “At least 15 cases each from three universities should be disposed of every month. Vice-chancellors (VC) and other officials concerned should also be present during the hearing of such cases.” As many as 36 cases, including 11 from Patna University, 10 from Aryabhatta Knowledge University and 15 from Jai Prakash University-Chhapra, were disposed of at a public hearing arranged at the Raj Bhavan on Wednesday. Most of them were related to appointment of dependants of deceased staff on compassionate ground, payment of arrears of retiral benefits, promotion of staff from retrospective effect, publication of pending results and disbursement of certificates. In several cases, the universities were directed to fulfil the genuine demands of the aggrieved staff as per the provisions of different Acts and statutes. VCs of all the three universities along with the officials of the chancellor’s secretariat were present at the hearing. Memorandum submitted: Bihar State Bharatiya Janata Party Teachers’ Cell convener and Patna University syndicate member Sudhakar Prasad Singh met the chancellor at the Raj Bhavan on Thursday. He submitted a memorandum, demanding immediate action against some VCs, who were allegedly engaged in making illegal appointments on extraneous considerations. He also demanded payment of four months’ salaries to the teachers and non-teaching staff of Pataliputra, Purnea and Munger universities and timely conduct of elections to students’ unions of different universities in the state. The chancellor is reported to have assured Singh of taking necessary action. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nBlind Fold performs at a party hosted.description: A restaurant in the city recently organised a musical evening for its patrons on the occasion of its second anniversary. Hosts Romie and Rupa were seen welcoming the guests, which comprised the creme-de-la-creme of the city.  Rock band Blind Fold performed live on the occasion, and the guests enjoyed the music and the sumptuous food. RJ Anjali, looking chic in her cat eye glasses, was spotted having a good time at the do along with her colleagues. STEALING THE SHOW: Songs like Intehan Ho Gayi Intezaar Ki,Chahoon Main Ya Na and Kabhi Jo Baadal Barse were among the most requested songs at the do. The guests enjoyed the dance performance by Tanushree Roy. Yashaswi Singh’s rendition of the song Khamoshiyaan mesmerised everyone, with the crowd demanding an encore. Later, Sagar, a professional dancer took over the stage and performed a few acts. SURPRISE IN STORE: Suman Sinha, a guest at the do, also happened to celebrate his birthday on the same day. A cake was called in for the birthday boy, and his friends made the occasion special for him. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Summer Season.description: NEW DELHI: Google on Friday celebrated the longest day of the year in Northern Hemisphere by dedicating a doodle. Also called summer solstice, or midsummer, the longest day occurs when one of the Earth's poles has its maximum tilt toward the Sun. What: The longest day (and shortest night) of the year in the Northern Hemisphere. When: Today (June 21). Technically, the solstice occurs when the sun is directly over the imaginary Tropic of Cancer or 23.5°N latitude. In 2019, this will occur at 3:54 pm GMT on Friday (or 9:24 pm IST). Why: The term 'solstice' comes from Latin —'sol' means sun and 'sistere' means to stand still. How: The 23.4° tilt in the Earth's axis causes varying amounts of sunlight to reach different regions during its year-long orbit around the Sun. Today, the North Pole is tipped more towards the Sun than on any other day of the year. However, that does not mean more heat or that the Earth is any closer to the Sun, per common misconceptions. Which: Summer solstices happen twice each year (once in each hemisphere). Summer solstice for the Northern Hemisphere = Winter solstice for the Southern Hemisphere, and vice-versa. Also, during Equinoxes (vernal and autumnal), the Sun shines directly on the Equator and the length of day and night are nearly equal in either hemisphere. Key dates for 2019 (Northern Hemisphere)Spring Equinox: Wednesday, March 20 Summer Solstice: Friday, June 21 Autumn Equinox: Monday, September 23 Winter Solstice: Sunday, December 22 FYI: The longest day of the year was the reason why Narendra Modi chose June 21 as the International Day of Yoga. Patna reels from long power cuts.description: PATNA: Heatwave has gripped the city and thrown life out of gear. To top it all, untimely power outages and voltage fluctuations in areas like Boring Road, Buddha Colony, Raja Bazar, Samanpura, Macchua Toli, Ramnagari, among others, have left Patnaites fuming. Ramnagari resident Arpita has had a harrowing time because of frequent power cuts in her area. She told this newspaper on Wednesday, “Electrical appliances like air conditioners (AC) and refrigerators are not functioning properly. As a result, the unbearable heat at night does not let my six-month-old child sleep well.” After performing household chores, which can take all day, homemaker Shabana Imam is usually exhausted. “At the end of the day, all I want is a peaceful sleep, but power cuts have made my life miserable,” the Samanpura resident rued. Students and office-goers have similar experiences to share. Boring Road resident Ayush Kaushik, who is pursuing BTech, asked, “Without proper supply of electricity, how will I study? What are the authorities doing?” Government employee Krishna Kumar Mishra, who lives in Rupaspur, loses his cool whenever he returns home from office and experiences untimely power outages. He said, “There are no power cuts or voltage fluctuations in office, but the moment I reach home, the situation is different.” Patna Electric Supply Undertaking (PESU) officials, however, pointed out that sufficient amount of electricity was being produced. According to PESU’s general manager Dilip Kumar Singh, the total electricity supply for Bihar is about 1,200MW and the average daily power demand of Patna is around 630MW these days. Singh claimed that an increase in individual power consumption often led to momentary tripping. “If informed, we can increase the capacity of transformers in an area and avoid frequent power cuts,” he said, adding officers were continuously monitoring power supply distribution and receiving complaints at fuse call centres in the city. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kullu road accident.description: MANALI: At least 44 people have died and 29 sustained injured on Thursday when a bus fell into a gorge in Himachal's Kullu district. Kullu superintendent of police (SP) Shalini Agnihotri said several women and kids were among the injured. The vehicle had started its journey from the Banjar bus stand around 4pm and covered barely 2km when it met with an accident. The driver apparently lost control while negotiating a sharp turn at the Bhiyoth Mor, which has a gradient of more than 75 degrees. Eyewitnesses said the bus veered off the road to scrape the mountain face before hurtling down the gorge. Local residents and police personnel faced difficulty locating and extricating the bodies from the mangled mass of metal. Parts of the vehicle were strewn over a wide swathe of the bottom of the gorge. Between 2009 and 2018, Himachal Pradesh recorded 30,993 road accidents in which 11,561 people were killed and 53,909 injured. This year alone, as many as 430 people died in 1,168 road accidents in the state till May 31. In Video:Several killed as bus falls into gorge in Himachal Pradesh's KulluDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Woman gang-raped in Patna, two arrested.description: PATNA: A 19-year-old married woman was allegedly gang-raped by two persons near Rajendra Nagar overbridge in the state capital around 2am on Tuesday. Police have arrested Ranjeet Kumar (30) and Chotu Kumar (28) and detained one Deepak Kumar (25) for interrogation in this connection. Ranjit is a painter by profession while Chotu and Deepak are e-rickshaw drivers. All three are residents of Lohanipur under the Kadamkuan police station area. DSP (town) Suresh Kumar said the victim has accused Ranjeet and Chotu of raping her. “She told the police that Deepak had tried to save her but failed,” he said, adding the victim was sent to hospital for medical examination. The matter surfaced when the woman approached Railway Protection Force (RPF) personnel after dodging Ranjeet and Deepak, who had brought her to platform number one of Rajendra Nagar Terminal to help her board a train to Mumbai. Rajendra Nagar RPF SHO RR Kashyap said Deepak and Ranjeet were arrested after a hot chase. “The RPF team with GRP men at the station visited the spot, which is a few hundred yards away, and handed her over to the local police for further action,” he said. Later, Kadamkaun police conducted raids and arrested Chotu from Lohanipur. City SP (central) Prantosh Kumar Das said the woman had fled from her house under the Tharthari police station area in Nalanda district on June 16 night. “She was not happy with her husband, who lives at Yarpur in Patna,” he said, adding she had come in contact with Deepak after reaching the city. Sources said Deepak first took her to his residence but his mother refused to keep an unknown woman there. “He was taking her to the railway station to board a train when Ranjeet and Chotu spotted them near the overbridge and took her to a secluded place where the victim was raped,” sources said. 10,000 likely to perform yoga at Patalip.description: PATNA: Thousands of fitness enthusiasts will take part in yoga and meditation sessions across the state on the occasion of the fifth International Yoga Day on Friday. According to sources, a mass yoga session will be jointly organized by the art, culture and youth affairs as well as health departments at Pataliputra Sports Complex in Kankerbagh. Governor Lalji Tandon has given his consent to be the chief guest at the two-hour event, which will begin from 5.30am. Deputy chief minister Sushil Kumar Modi, health minister Mangal Pandey, tourism minister Krishna Kumar Rishi and art, culture and youth affairs minister Pramod Kumar, among others, will also attend the event. More than 10,000 people are likely to participate in the session, which will be led by Art of Living (Bengaluru) volunteer Swami Brahmachit. Pramod Kumar, who inspected the sports complex on Thursday, said the event would not be elaborate this time, owing to AES deaths in Muzaffarpur. “Water kiosks have been installed at the venue and arrangements made to provide fruits to the participants,” the minister said, adding yoga sessions would be organized in other parts of the state as well with the help of Patanjali, Art of Living, NGOs, self-help and social awareness groups. This year’s theme for International Yoga Day is ‘Climate Action’. Different colleges, universities, NGOs, public sector undertakings, government departments and voluntary organizations will also celebrate the day by organizing yoga camps. Patna airport director Bhupesh C H Negi told this newspaper, “Since construction work for a new terminal building is underway, the Airports Authority of India will conduct a yoga session in the fire services area.” The Bihar Industries Association (BIA) will also organize a yoga session at its office from 6am to 8am on Friday. “Bankipore MLA Nitin Naveen will be present on the occasion,” BIA secretary Anil Kumar Sinha said. Bihar Urban Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited, a wing of the urban development and housing department, will hold a yoga camp at the Ganga riverfront. AES deaths put spotlight on malnutrition.description: PATNA: The death of around 120 children due to acute encephalitis syndrome in Bihar has not only exposed the inadequacy of the government run-child nutritional programmes in the state, but has put the focus on the underlying cause — extreme poverty and consequent malnutrition. Poverty-induced malnutrition has been identified as one of the main causes of AES deaths in Muzaffarpur and neighbouring districts as most victims of this disease have been found to be from Dalit and Mahadalit communities. According to a National Family Health Survey, Bihar has around 27 lakh children under the age of five who suffer from ‘acute malnutrition’ and nine lakh of them are under the ‘severe acute malnutrition’ category. “Malnutrition is a serious issue in Bihar, which aggravates this disease. For instance, high level of stunting has been found among kids less than five years in the affected districts, including Muzaffarpur, Sitamarhi, Vaishali and East Champaran,” said Rabi Parhi, nutrition specialist, UNICEF- Bihar. Acknowledging the lack of sufficient nutrition in AES-affected children, the Integrated Child Development Services (IDCS) wing of the state health department issued an advisory on Thursday. The advisory outlines steps, which includes providing nutritional supplements, to be taken by anganwadi sevikas and other officials for prevention of the disease. It also lays out dos and don’ts while dealing with cases of suspected AES. The ICDS provides nutrition and health services for children under the age of six and pregnant or breastfeeding women, as well as preschool activities for children age 3-5 years. These services are provided through community-based anganwadi centres. “We have endorsed the advisory issued by the health department on AES to all district programme managers and Anganwadi Sevilkas to take the required steps,” ICDS director Alok Kumar told TOI on Thursday. He, however, said that malnutrition has not been directly linked with AES. But Muzaffarpur- based senior paediatrician Arun Shah, who is also a member of the national executive committee of the Indian Paediatrics Association, has attributed malnutrition as one of the main causes behind the spread of the disease. “In a sudden fall of glucose (known as hypoglycaemia in medical parlance) in human body, it is automatically supplied by the reserved glucose in the body. A malnourished child has no such reserve in his or her body, thus he or she falls prey to the disease,” Shah said. The sudden fall in glucose level has been attributed in many researches to consumption of unripe litchis by children, followed by lack of a proper meal at night. “The unripe litchi contains a high concentration of the toxin called methylenecyclopropylglycine (MCPG), which triggers hypoglycemia if consumed by a child with a malnourished body,” Shah added. As per National Family Health Survey (NFHS-4, 2015-16), only 34% of children in Bihar receive supplementary food at anganwadi centres. This has been corroborated by residents of the affected villages in Muzaffarpur, which has been the epicentre of AES outbreaks almost every year since 1995. They claim that villagers hardly get any benefits of the ICDS programme or the anganwadi centres. Krishna Prasad, resident of Mustafapur village in Kanti block in Muzaffarpur, whose 10-year child died on June 10, said: “The Anganbadi centre in our village is not open for more than 10 days in a month,” he said. Prasad also alleged that the anganwadi sevika runs the centre from her home. The NFHS-4 report says that only around 49% of children under the age of six in Bihar receive services of any kind from anganwadi centres. It also says that 48% of children under the age of five are stunted or too short for their age, which indicated that they were undernourished for some time. Also, 48% of the kids in the same age group were underweight, which takes into account both chronic and acute undernutrition.  “World Health Organization has stated that 45% of the deaths among kids aged up to five years across the globe is due to malnutrition. Thus, there is urgent need of spreading awareness and taking steps for eradicating malnutrition to prevent fatal diseases like AES,” UNICEF-Bihar’s Parhi said. Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. Yoga is above religion, caste, colour, gender and region, it is above everything," he told the gathering. Yoga is ancient and modern. It is constant and evolving. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015. \nYoungsters organise a party at a disc.description: A party was recently organised by a group of youngsters at a city disc to mark the start of the holiday season.  Aditya, one of the organisers, told us, “The idea was to provide a change to the college students who have just got free from exams. I hope the party will be a fun event for people who want to dance and enjoy.” The girls donned pretty dresses and skirts at the part, while the boys were spotted in casual attire. Janvi looked elegant in her black dress, along with Sneha, who was dressed in a floral frock.ABHI TOH PARTY SHURU HUI HAI:  DJ Zeeshan set the mood for the party by belting out popular dance numbers. However, it wasn’t just contemporary Bollywood songs that ruled the roost. The youngsters also had fun dancing to songs from the 90s like Ole Ole, My Name is Lakhan and Main Khiladi Tu Anari. — Swati.Savarn@timesgroup.com Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Patna: Hospitals take measures to handle.description: PATNA: The government hospitals in city have initiated several measures to deal with heatstroke cases following an advisory issued by Bihar State Health Society (SHS), a wing of health department. The government hospitals have earmarked separate beds in ICU and general wards for heatstroke patients. Doctors and nurses of general wards have been asked to give priority to patients suffering from heat-related ailments like fever, nausea, dehydration and cramps. Indira Gandhi Institute of Medical Sciences (IGIMS) medical superintendent Dr Manish Mandal told this newspaper that five beds each in ICU and general ward have been earmarked for heatstroke patients. “The hospital is equipped to tackle such routine cases. However, no heatstroke case has been reported at IGIMS so far,” he said. Patna Medical College and Hospital (PMCH) has a separate ward with five beds for heatstroke patients. No control room has been set up at the hospital as the number of cases is not alarming, said PMCH superintendent Dr Rajiv Ranjan Prasad. Dr Rajiv said two or three patients are admitted and get discharged after treatment per day. “The airconditioned ward for heatstroke patients is equipped with ventilator, oxygen mask and cylinder besides required drugs and fluids,” he said. At AIIMS-Patna, the internal medicine department has instructed the doctors to treat heatstroke patients on priority basis. Head of internal medicine department, Dr Ravi Kirti, said the hospital is well-equipped with required drugs and electrolyte, ORS and fluids. “We are prepared to handle patients of heatstroke and don’t require any special arrangements for that,” he told this newspaper. Nalanda Medical College and Hospital (NMCH) medical superintendent Dr Chandra Shekhar said the hospital meets all the requirements mentioned in the advisory issued by the health department. “We have ample ORS, electrolyte and paracetamol to treat heatstroke patients,” he added. Girls worried over safety in public tran.description: PATNA: The alleged rape of a married woman by e-rickshaw drivers near Rajendra Nagar overbridge around 2am on Tuesday has raised questions on night police patrolling and safety of women and girls in the city. Patna SP (central) Prantosh Kumar Das said 20 checking points have been made in the city while police patrolling has been intensified after the parliamentary elections. “The police need to figure out the incident and then only we will be able to find out lapses in this case in order to strengthen our policing. If there is any lack on the part police, action will be taken against the duty officers,” he told this newspaper. When asked about the incident, Patna Autorickshaw Association’s secretary Ranjit Kumar said, “I criticize such incidents. This is unacceptable. Autorickshaw drivers in Patna are not behind such crime, but those who come here from outside to work are the real culprits.” Raj Kumar, general secretary of Bihar State Auto Chalak Sangh, said, “The administration has to be blamed for this. They need to take measures for women safety. Such an incident, involving an autorickshaw driver, has happened after 15 years in Patna. The guilty should be punished.” Girls in the city, on the other hand, expressed concern over their safety. Shreya Sinha (22) of Bailey Road said, “I stay in a hostel. I have no other means of travelling except autorickshaws and e-rickshaws. Sometimes it becomes very uncomfortable as people stare at me. During nights, I make sure to engage some friends or family members in phone calls while travelling.” Several girls claimed that the bus stops in the city are not a good place for women to wait as men often pass lewd comments on them. Amrita Das of Ashiana Nagar said, “This incident is shameful. Strict punishment should be given to the culprits.” She added: “As a woman, I am really feeling unsafe while going out in the city at night.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Property of murder accused attached.description: PATNA: Police on Thursday attached the property of notorious Shankar Rai alias Shankar Gop from his residence at Dujra Chak under Buddha Colony police station area here for his alleged involvement in the killing of another notorious criminal Ravi Gop alias Ravi Rai. Ravi was shot dead near Kidwaipuri park in broad daylight on May 27. Two criminals on a bike had reached the spot and shot Ravi multiple times killing him on the spot. On June 1, police had arrested one Amit Kumar, who runs a hostel at Sai Gali under Buddha Colony police station area for harbouring the killers before and after murder. Buddha Colony police station SHO Dayanand Singh said police had moved the court for Shankar’s property attachment as he was evading arrest. “Police have also procured property attachment orders against Bhola Rai of Parsa Bazaar and Sippu Mahto of Athmalgola who were contract killers hired by Shankar for killing Ravi,” the SHO said. Singh also said court orders against the two killers would also be executed soon. While slain Ravi was an accused in more than 19 cases, Shankar is also an accused in several cases. Bhola is evading arrest since the last 11 years and during the course of investigation, his name had also surfaced in the killing of RJD leader Dina Gope near his residence at Anisabad on May 12 last year using an AK-47 assault rifle.
